title: Filipa Patão shared her thoughts on becoming the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Filipa Patão, former Benfica manager, is Boston Legacy FC's inaugural head coach.
Patão emphasizes Boston's sports tradition and aligns her goals with the club's ambitions.
Read what Sports News Pat said on September 4, 2025 | 3:21 PM 4 minutes to read Sha.

title: Jeremy Swayman feels like a ‘completely different human being’ a year removed from contract dispute
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman signed an eight-year, $66 million contract with the Bruins, resolving last year's contract dispute.
Swayman struggled last season, posting the worst save percentage of his career after missing training camp amid contract negotiations.
Inside: the board’s role—and what happens next.

title: What Josh McDaniels said about facing the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels ready to face his former team, the Raiders, in Sunday's Patriots home opener at Gillette Stadium.
McDaniels reflects on his time with the Raiders, having posted a 9-16 record during his tenure in Las Vegas.
Notice how McDaniels utilizes lessons from past challenges to guide the Patriots' offensive strategy this season.

title: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read: What readers said about the limited series role
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read in an upcoming limited series on Prime Video about a high-profile murder case.
A Boston.com poll shows 48% support for Banks in the role, with 38% opposing and 14% undecided or indifferent.
Next step is scheduled (June)—agenda details inside.

title: 2 New England casinos just ranked the best in the U.S. (that aren’t in Las Vegas)
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mohegan Sun and Foxwoods Resort Casino ranked No. 2 and No. 3 in the USA Today's best non-Vegas casino list.
These Connecticut casinos are praised for their expansive gaming options and stellar guest experiences, offering diverse entertainment choices.
Two paths are on the table; the trade-offs are laid out inside.

title: What to know about Seisiún, the two-day Irish music festival coming to Boston
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: The Seisiún Irish music festival at Suffolk Downs features headliners Dropkick Murphys and The Pogues, making a first U.S. appearance in 20 years.
One-day tickets range from $75 to $257. Festival attendees are advised to use public transit due to limited parking availability.
Delve into why Boston's cultural connection makes it the 'true capital of Ireland,' as stated by festival producers.

title: CommonWealth Kitchen staff, members speak out over toxic nonprofit: Globe report
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: CommonWealth Kitchen faces allegations from staff and members of fostering a toxic workplace environment, according to a Globe report.
The article highlights internal strife involving accusations against Jen Faigel and shifting board dynamics at the nonprofit food incubator.
Examine how CommonWealth Kitchen addresses concerns over its support for minority-owned businesses amidst these serious allegations.

title: 44 proposed Mass. ballot questions, including rent control, move to next step — and 3 don’t make the cut
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Forty-four proposed Massachusetts ballot questions advance for potential inclusion in the November 2026 and 2028 ballots following Attorney General Campbell's review.
Thirteen initiatives require additional signatures or legislative approval by July 1 to secure a spot on the ballot.
Attorney General Andrea Campbell emphasized the strict criteria applied in evaluating each initiative's eligibility under Article 48.

title: RFK Jr. tries to defend COVID vaccine stance in raucous Senate hearing
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Sen. Elizabeth Warren clashed with Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. at a Senate hearing on COVID-19 vaccine recommendations.
Robert F. Kennedy Jr. faced bipartisan questioning as he defended his stance on vaccines during a three-hour Senate committee hearing.
Politics He could be decisive—why they matter is in the piece.

title: Juvenile with ‘airsoft replica weapon’ determined to have caused UMass Lowell lockdown
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A juvenile with an airsoft replica weapon caused a lockdown at UMass Lowell, prompting a major police response.
Authorities confirmed there were no shots fired or injuries in the incident, and the airsoft gun has been recovered.
Consider how realistic-looking airsoft guns can complicate security responses and the burden they place on local and federal resources.
